DataElement.preferredName: Specimen Collection Group Clinical Diagnosis ICD-O-3 Morphology Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Five-digit codes representing the histology (morphology) of neoplasms from the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (ICD-O-3) for the specimen or collection of specimens.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A sample or part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:The act of gathering things together.:Any number of entities (members) considered as a unit._A diagnosis made from a study of the signs and symptoms of a disease. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A sample or part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:The act of gathering things together.:Any number of entities (members) considered as a unit.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
Any number of entities (members) considered as a unit.

Property.preferredDefinition: A diagnosis made from a study of the signs and symptoms of a disease. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: A diagnosis made from a study of the signs and symptoms of a disease.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Five-digit codes representing the histology  (morphology) of neoplasms from the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (ICD-O-3). The first four digits indicate the specific histological term. The fifth digit after the slash or solidus (/) is a behaviour code which indicates whether a tumour is malignant, benign, in situ, or uncertain whether benign or malignant. [Explanatory Comment: A URL to a downloadable Excel file containing the permissible values for this Value Domain is provided in Reference Documents.]

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, third edition (ICD-O-3).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Value Domain Source of Values
ReferenceDocuments.description: ICD-O-3 terms can be found by search NCI Metathesaurus at the URL provided.  Search for Morphology and select the concept C0332437.  From the list at View neighborhood select ICDO3, to find individual terms and concepts.                                                                                                                                                 ICD-O-3 terms may be found by seaching the NCI Metathesaurus at the URL provided.  Search for Morphology and use the concept C0332437.  To see individual terms, go to View neighborhood and choose ICDO3 from the list.
